item.title: Denise add a quote by Barry Lopez
item.description: "Everything is held together with stories. That is all that is holding us together, stories and compassion." -- Barry Lopez

item.title: Denise add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Denise add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Denise add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Speaking personally, you can have my gun, but you'll take my book when you pry my cold, dead fingers off of the binding." -- Stephen King

item.title: Denise add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "You cannot write for children. They're much too complicated. You can only write books that are of interest to them. " -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Denise add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Denise add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. <I>Thou shalt not</I> is soon forgotten, but <I>Once upon a time</I> lasts forever." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Denise add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How many a man has dated a new era in his life from the reading of a book." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Denise add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Denise add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Denise add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Denise add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Denise add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "It had been startling and disappointing to me to find out that story books had been written by people, that books were not natural wonders, coming up of themselves like grass. Yet regardless of where they come from, I cannot remember a time when I was not in love with them -- with the books themselves, cover and binding and the paper they were printed on, with their smell and their weight and with their possession in my arms, captured and carried off to myself. Still illiterate, I was ready for them, committed to all the reading I could give them ..." -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Denise add a quote by Mary Cantwell
item.description: "To be involved with books is to live at the heart of light." -- Mary Cantwell

item.title: Denise add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Denise add a quote by John Kiernan
item.description: "I am a part of everything that I have read." -- John Kiernan

item.title: Denise add a quote by Carl Rowan
item.description: "The library is the temple of learning, and learning has liberated more people than all the wars in history. " -- Carl Rowan

item.title: Denise add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Denise add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "A good book is the precious life-blood of a master spirit, embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life." -- John Milton

item.title: Denise add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Denise add a quote by Richard Peck
Denise add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "And what is the use of a book," thought Alice, "without pictures or conversation?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Denise add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "No story ever really ends, and I think I know why. " -- George MacDonald

item.title: Denise add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "There is something about that moment, when literature becomes accessible, and a door of the world opens. " -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Denise add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description: "Time spent reading, like time spent loving, increases our lifetime. " -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: Denise add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "Good as it is to inherit a library, it is better to collect one." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Denise add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "When you sell a man a book you don't sell just twelve ounces of paper and ink and glue - you sell him a whole new life. Love and friendship and humour and ships at sea by night - there's all heaven and earth in a book, a real book." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Denise add a quote by Emilie Buchwald
item.description: "Children are made readers on the laps of their parents." -- Emilie Buchwald

item.title: Denise add a quote by Aidan Chambers
item.description: "Readers are made by readers. " -- Aidan Chambers

item.title: Denise add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Children know perfectly well that unicorns aren’t real, but they also know that books about unicorns, if they are good books, are true books." -- Ursula K. Le Guin
